# Command Reference {#sec-appendix-commands}

This appendix provides a quick reference for commands covered throughout the book.

## Unix Navigation Commands

| Command | Description | Example |
|:--------|:------------|:--------|
| `pwd` | Print working directory | `pwd` |
| `ls` | List directory contents | `ls -la` |
| `cd` | Change directory | `cd ~/projects` |
| `mkdir` | Create directory | `mkdir -p data/raw` |
| `rmdir` | Remove empty directory | `rmdir old_folder` |

: Navigation commands {#tbl-nav-commands}

## File Operations

| Command | Description | Example |
|:--------|:------------|:--------|
| `cp` | Copy files/directories | `cp file.txt backup/` |
| `mv` | Move or rename | `mv old.txt new.txt` |
| `rm` | Remove files | `rm -r old_directory/` |
| `touch` | Create empty file | `touch notes.txt` |
| `cat` | Display file contents | `cat data.csv` |
| `head` | Show first lines | `head -n 20 file.txt` |
| `tail` | Show last lines | `tail -f log.txt` |
| `less` | Page through file | `less huge_file.txt` |
| `wc` | Count lines/words/bytes | `wc -l data.csv` |

: File operation commands {#tbl-file-commands}

## Text Processing

| Command | Description | Example |
|:--------|:------------|:--------|
| `grep` | Search for patterns | `grep "error" log.txt` |
| `grep -E` | Extended regex | `grep -E "gene[0-9]+"` |
| `grep -v` | Invert match | `grep -v "^#" data.txt` |
| `grep -c` | Count matches | `grep -c ">" seqs.fa` |
| `grep -i` | Case insensitive | `grep -i "warning"` |
| `sort` | Sort lines | `sort -n numbers.txt` |
| `uniq` | Remove duplicates | `sort \| uniq -c` |
| `cut` | Extract columns | `cut -f2 data.tsv` |
| `tr` | Translate characters | `tr 'a-z' 'A-Z'` |
| `sed` | Stream editor | `sed 's/old/new/g'` |
| `awk` | Pattern processing | `awk '{print $1}'` |

: Text processing commands {#tbl-text-commands}

## Redirection and Pipes

| Operator | Description | Example |
|:---------|:------------|:--------|
| `>` | Redirect output (overwrite) | `ls > files.txt` |
| `>>` | Redirect output (append) | `echo "done" >> log.txt` |
| `<` | Redirect input | `wc -l < data.txt` |
| `2>` | Redirect stderr | `cmd 2> errors.txt` |
| `&>` | Redirect both stdout/stderr | `cmd &> all.txt` |
| `\|` | Pipe to next command | `cat file \| sort \| uniq` |
| `\|&` | Pipe stdout and stderr | `cmd \|& less` |

: Redirection operators {#tbl-redirect-commands}

## File Compression

| Command | Description | Example |
|:--------|:------------|:--------|
| `gzip` | Compress file | `gzip large_file.txt` |
| `gunzip` | Decompress | `gunzip file.txt.gz` |
| `zcat` | View compressed | `zcat data.gz \| head` |
| `zgrep` | Search compressed | `zgrep "pattern" file.gz` |

## File Permissions

| Command | Description | Example |
|:--------|:------------|:--------|
| `chmod` | Change permissions | `chmod +x script.sh` |
| `chmod` | Numeric permissions | `chmod 755 script.sh` |
| `chown` | Change owner | `chown user:group file` |

### Permission Codes

| Mode | Meaning |
|:-----|:--------|
| `r` (4) | Read |
| `w` (2) | Write |
| `x` (1) | Execute |
| `755` | rwx for owner, rx for others |
| `644` | rw for owner, r for others |

| `git diff` | Show unstaged changes |

### Remote Operations

| Command | Description |
|:--------|:------------|

| `git fetch origin` | Fetch without merge |

## SLURM Commands

### Job Submission

| Command | Description |
|:--------|:------------|
| `sbatch script.sh` | Submit batch job |
| `srun --pty bash` | Start interactive job |

### Job Management

| Command | Description |
|:--------|:------------|
| `squeue -u $USER` | Show your jobs |
| `squeue -p partition` | Show partition jobs |
| `scancel JOBID` | Cancel job |
| `scancel -u $USER` | Cancel all your jobs |
| `scontrol show job JOBID` | Job details |
| `sacct -j JOBID` | Job accounting |

### Information

| Command | Description |
|:--------|:------------|
| `sinfo` | Partition information |
| `sinfo -p partition` | Specific partition |

### Common SBATCH Directives

```bash
#SBATCH --job-name=name       # Job name
#SBATCH --partition=compute   # Partition
#SBATCH --account=PIRG        # Account
#SBATCH --time=HH:MM:SS       # Time limit
#SBATCH --nodes=1             # Number of nodes
#SBATCH --cpus-per-task=4     # CPUs per task
#SBATCH --mem=16G             # Memory
#SBATCH --gres=gpu:1          # GPUs
#SBATCH --output=out_%j.log   # Output file
#SBATCH --error=err_%j.log    # Error file
```

## R Quick Reference

### Basic Operations

```r
# Assignment
x <- 5

# Vectors
v <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5)

# Sequences
1:10
seq(0, 1, by = 0.1)

# Basic stats
mean(v)
sd(v)
summary(v)
```

### Data Frames

```r
# Create
df <- data.frame(x = 1:3, y = c("a", "b", "c"))

# Access
df$x
df[1, ]
df[, "x"]

# Filter
df[df$x > 1, ]

# Read/Write
read.csv("file.csv")
write.csv(df, "file.csv", row.names = FALSE)
```

### Getting Help

```r
?function_name
help(function_name)
example(function_name)
```

## Regular Expression Metacharacters

| Character | Meaning |
|:----------|:--------|
| `.` | Any single character |
| `*` | Zero or more of preceding |
| `+` | One or more of preceding |
| `?` | Zero or one of preceding |
| `^` | Start of line |
| `$` | End of line |
| `[]` | Character class |
| `[^]` | Negated class |
| `\|` | Alternation (OR) |
| `()` | Grouping |
| `{n}` | Exactly n repetitions |
| `{n,m}` | Between n and m repetitions |
| `\` | Escape special character |

: Regular expression metacharacters {#tbl-regex-ref}

## Useful Shortcuts

### Bash Keyboard Shortcuts

| Shortcut | Action |
|:---------|:-------|
| `Ctrl+C` | Cancel current command |
| `Ctrl+D` | End of input / logout |
| `Ctrl+L` | Clear screen |
| `Ctrl+A` | Move to start of line |
| `Ctrl+E` | Move to end of line |
| `Ctrl+R` | Search command history |
| `Tab` | Autocomplete |
| `↑` / `↓` | Previous/next command |

### RStudio Keyboard Shortcuts

| Shortcut | Action |
|:---------|:-------|
| `Ctrl+Enter` | Run current line |
| `Ctrl+Shift+Enter` | Run current chunk |
| `Ctrl+Shift+S` | Run entire script |
| `Ctrl+Shift+C` | Comment/uncomment |
| `Ctrl+Shift+M` | Insert pipe `%>%` |
| `Alt+-` | Insert assignment `<-` |
| `Ctrl+Shift+K` | Knit document |
